Reviews.Content: Lovely Villas -Beautiful Scenery We stayed 3 nights as part of our trip in Bali.We were really suprised with the nature around villas and a river crossing them and a common pool with excellent view.We stayed in a plunge pool villa whch was spacious traditionaly decorated 'Balinese style'.Definately we loved the privacy of the pool and the lovely garden of the villa.Staff was friedly and we had used room service a couple of times including dinner in the villa.The brekfast is American Breakfast with not a great variety, however enough for a good start.The hotel is offering scheduled shuttle service to UBUD whichis 15-20 min away.
Reviews.Author: ROULA-THANOS

Reviews.Content: regainRR@hotmail.com One of the best place I stayed so far ... I was suppose to stayed 4 nights, I stayed 3 weeks. This something very magical about that place...calm, luxurious, wonderfull staff, faire price, in the middle of rice feilds and a lot of temples around (about 10 kms from UBUD ...6 free shuttles a day go to town).
Reviews.Author: RivQuebec

Reviews.Content: TIRED.....BUT RELAXING We began our trip in Bali with eight nights at Aston Legend and finished off with another eight here. After the amazing experience of Aston, this place left a little to be desired......Firstly, it is a LONG WAY from anywhere.......It is in a beautiful rural area, and although it can be part of the appeal (nothing to do but lying by the pool reading!), it does have its limits . If you are not content with eating at their restuarant (which is a little lacking.....) then you're in for a twenty minute car trip into Ubud (which if you take the free shuttle, must be stirctly scheduled.) We found it easier to keep the details of a driver based in Ubud and call them when required (this cost about 70000rp per trip)The staff were a little vague (we were introduced to the hotels tours and services on our second last day, and advised of the special crispy duck after it had been on the menu for a week!, but their smiles and genuine innocence seem to make it acceptable. The rooms were quite tired - ours had a badly leaking air conditioner, a very bad ant problem in the toilet. and the other gorup we were travelling with actually changed rooms due to poor condition of various items (air conditioner, doors not locking etc.). All in all, quite a nice resort to finish a holiday, although i'd go for three nights, and spend the rest closer to the centre of Ubud, (and closer to Mozaic Restuarant!!!)
Reviews.Author: delndan

Reviews.Content: amazing enviroment we stayed at the hotel for 3nights. the hotel is located quite far from ubud. (20-30mins) by car. however, if you want to have a quiet and relaxing holiday, this hotel is really recommended.we stayed in the plunge pool villa. the room was really big and spacious. there was a separate toilet and bathroom. the bathroom had a big bathtub. it is worth staying in this room.the spa was ok, not the best.the hotel area was really big. there was a swimming pool, restaurant, waterfall, spa, river, yoga and meditation area. i wish we could had more time to explore around the hotel. we had breakfast every morning. i liked the glass noodles. their dinner menu seems average, so we went out every night in ubud. there is a coach service from the hotel.the staff were really helpful. although some of staff`s english was not perfect, they really tried hard to make us comfortable.we do want to come back if we have a chance.
Reviews.Author: churachura

Reviews.Content: indeed a very nice hotel Normally we had booked a garden villa, but since they only had the king sized bed, and I was travelling with my 18 year old son, and wanted twin beds, we got another room. This was sorted out in a few minutes, while having a complementary drink and a cool towel. And yes I have traveled a lot in my life, but I also found this a very beatiful hotel for the price you pay. I found the location excellent in a real tropical valley, so nice and quiet (if you like quiet). We were travelling with four other people on a five day tour and they all liked this hotel the most. The rooms are really nice with confortable beds. We had an indoor bathroom with a sunken bath and a view. I have to admit that getting to the room you had to do several steps up, but for me it was worth it. We ate breakfast and dinner at the restaurant, which was OK, but nothing special. But the setting makes everything so special. I would defenitely recommand this hotel for people who like a nice quiet hide-away during their stay in Bali for a few days. I only stayed one night, but I would like to return with my husband and then stay a few days more.
Reviews.Author: poligirlBelgium

Reviews.Author: freshia31

Reviews.Content: Relaxing Haven Stayed at the Santi Mandala in Sept 2007 and had a wonderful experience. I was very pleased with the accommodations. We enjoyed a private garden villa that was very well kept. The staff was friendly, always helpful and quick to assist with anything we needed.While it's true that the resort is about a 20 minute drive from Ubud, being in the remote, more local surroundings offers an authentic experience. The hotel shuttle service is reliable, and it's extremely easy to hire a taxi driver in Ubud - and the price is negotiable. Went mountain biking with a hotel guide for a fun journey through local Balinese villages and rice fields. We toured through a traditional Balinese housing compound and visited a beautiful temple. Then enjoyed fresh fruit and tea - well worth the price.It was low season, so we felt like we had the place to ourselves. The included breakfast was good. But do eat dinner in the many great restaurants in Ubud. It was a relaxing haven!
Reviews.Author: Leigh_Ann_CA

Reviews.Content: A little Gem Santa Mandala is a little gem that I hope will stay this way. If you love nature, peace and tranquility and are not seeking night life, this is it. The staff are wonderful, genuine and always eager to try and make your holiday a memorable one. The villa was spotless, very romantic and we had a wonderful view, not luxurious but 'special'. The spa treatment we had was bliss. Yes it's more expensive than you would pay in Ubud, but please support whats on offer otherwise the spa may not survive. Please also support Mr. Bhutto who runs the guest activities. We really enjoyed his early morning yoga, as the sun was coming up and the bike ride into the surrounding countryside. The only negative experience was trying to settle our bill with our credit card. Please be warned that certain cards are not accepted around Ubud and we had a frantic time trying to find an ATM that would dispense enough cash. Also we discovered it is better to inform your bank before you go to these offbeat areas. It certainly has not put us off the thought of going back. Thank you Santa Mandala which translated means 'peaceful place'.
Reviews.Author: Amy30

Reviews.Content: Nice but too far from Ubud       Hotel
Reviews.Author: Katergo

Reviews.Content: Santi Mandala - Would choose something else The Santi Mandala Villas are pretty nice. We stayed in 5 different hotels while we were in Bali. The Villas are comfortable but of course look nicer in pictures. The River running through it looks quite polluted. But it's nice in the morning hearing all the birds, roosters, ducks waking up at sunrise. The staff was friendly and the hotel offers free shuttle service to Ubud every hour or two.The only problem is that Ubud is quite far from Santi Mandala (approx 15 minute car ride). This means that there is NOTHING to do at night unless you want to find rides into town.
Reviews.Author: RanchuBoy

Reviews.Content: Fell in Love with Santi Mandala We had an unbelievable stay at Santi Mandala Resort. It was absolutely beautiful and the staff couldn't do enough to serve our every need. It is located in magnificent surroundings that evoke a feeling of serenity and tranquility. Booking through AsiaRooms was great as we received a terrific room at a wonderfully discounted price.
Reviews.Author: Meadow357

Reviews.Content: Paradise on Bali Just returned from a wonderful week at the Santi Mandala. I am a travel agent and had booked some clients for their honeymoon at the Santi Mandala a couple of months ago on the basis of tripadvisor reports. They returned with glowing reports.As it was time for myself and wife to take a holiday and as we'd beencontemplating a long-haul break, we decided to go with the recommendations.It is rare in life that reality lives up to expectation. At Santi Mandala reality surpasses expectation. The setting in the little valley, with all the greenery, the harmonious architecture, the wonderfully relaxed atmosphere - great, but for me what made the place was the staff. I can still see those wide Balinese smiles now, as I write.I repeat the comments of others re. the distance from Ubud, which was our primary goal, and where we ate every evening. It was not an issue at all. The shuttle service was excellent and the couple of occasions when we missed the shuttle or preferred to stay a while longer, it cost just $5 to get a taxi. And it was always nice to return to the serenity of the Santi Mandala.If you wish to experience a bit of real Bali with luxury and peace, rather than the terrible tourist compounds of Nusa Dua, then you can't go wrong with Santi Mandala.
Reviews.Author: mikeje

Reviews.Content: I'll be back there! I stayed for 10 nights in May 06, couldnt believe how lucky we were. We stayed in Garden Villa 101. Very clean for my standard. As soon as we get in our room, I knew we will comeback. Great service (as always...the Balinese way), the security guard is very lovely, their Bubur Ayam breakfast is yummy...and dont forget to try their Spa. Eggscellent!! I booked through balibagus.com for only 拢40 per night! Bargain bargain. Try upandaway.com as well. Great rate!I do recommend their Indonesian/Bali menu. You are in Bali so it is their speciality. I will be back in July 07. Cant waiit.....
Reviews.Author: nholtom

Reviews.Content: Wonderful, but eat elsewhere We booked a villa with private pool (5 nights) at a decent rate through passionasia. The room and resort were beautiful, Santi Mandala is a real haven.We treated ourselves to a couple of spa packages which were ok value (around 拢40 for 4 hours of massage/masque/facial etc) and definitely woth doing at least once to enjoy to exceptionally serene spa location.Our only gripe was the food - well below average (and expensive compared to restaurants in Ubud). Breakfast was included in the room rate, but was uninspired and poorly cooked (for example, scrambled egg arrived on slightly hard bread rather than toast). We ate dinner in the restaurant once and my girlfriend's chicken had to be sent back as it was still raw in the centre! My pumpkin soup was so salty in was inedible. The only other time we ate there was lunch on one occasion and the food was similarly poor (prawn salad contained just two prawns and soup tasted like it came out of can).On the brightside the hotel provides a shuttle to Ubud, either for free or around 拢3 depending on when you want to go. Suffice to say we ate at restaurants there every evening and in every case the food was far superior and more reasonably priced to Santi Mandala.Mantenance could have been better: two lightbulbs were dead throughout our stay, the bathtub plug lever was broken and the sink drain was very slow, but these are minor gripes and on the whole the room was very good value for the price paid (around 拢65 per night).I would wholly recommend this resort provided you get a decent discount and are prepared to eat out. We left feeling refreshed with great memories.
Reviews.Author: Justinmod

Reviews.Content: Pure bliss The hotel is absolutely beautiful and very quiet. The pictures do not do this place justice. Each villa is private and the staff are so friendly. The only thing most the villas do lack is a view, but this is more than made up for by the uniqueness of each villa. Never have I stayed somewhere so reasonable yet so relaxing.The hotel is not in the centre of Ubud, but why would you want to be, this location is perfect: privacy without isolation. There is a shuttle bus to take you to Ubud, and the hotel staff are happy to take you to Ubud outside of the shuttle bus hours for a small fee. Ubud itself is a cultural haven, although the monkey's in the monkey forest are absolutely terrifying. I got chased for bananas I was led to believe you needed to take into the forest and had to throw them on the floor to escape the stampede chasing me. Although i'm 6' I was no match for those rascals! The peace of the hotel was certaintly most welcome after that mini adventure!
Reviews.Author: Davey83

Reviews.Content: Santi Mandala - Pure Bliss
Reviews.Author: flyboylee

Reviews.Content: absolutely loved Santi Mandala We absolutely loved this hotel. We stayed there 4 nights and booked it through the hotel reservation desk at Denpasar airport at a real bargain price ($65).The hotel covers 3.5 acres at both sides of a small river. We stayed in garden view cottage nr 102 and can highly recommend this. The cottage's private garden overlooking water with oudoors bathroom is breathtaking. The location is just amazing as is the pool at the left bank of the river. Amazing scenery and views on tropical forest as well.Opposite the lobby is a lovely little temple. Coincidently, on June 7th, they held a ceremony with dragon dances (and attendable if dressed appropriately), which added further value.The only drawback is the distance from Ubud centre (20min by car) but fully compensated for by free shuttle buses. Besides, after 21.00h the Ubud's central streets are pretty empty after all. As a compairison, we stayed the following 2 nights in the Ubud Village hotel in the middle of the centre just to try another hotel. Although we paid the same price and were upgraded to superior room, we 'd definitely favour the Santi, just because of its tranquility and serenity. The small pool in Ubud Village hotel is quite unappealing as well
